   20: 
   21: -module(bs_construct_SUITE).
   22: 
   23: -export([all/0, suite/0,
   24:          init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1,
   25: 	 test1/1, test2/1, test3/1, test4/1, test5/1, testf/1,
   26: 	 not_used/1, in_guard/1,
   27: 	 mem_leak/1, coerce_to_float/1, bjorn/1, append_empty_is_same/1,
   28: 	 huge_float_field/1, system_limit/1, badarg/1,
   29: 	 copy_writable_binary/1, kostis/1, dynamic/1, bs_add/1,
   30: 	 otp_7422/1, zero_width/1, bad_append/1, bs_append_overflow/1,
   31:          bs_append_offheap/1,
   32:          reductions/1, fp16/1, error_info/1]).
   33: 
   34: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   35: 
   36: suite() ->
   37:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   38:      {timetrap, {minutes, 1}}].
   39: 
   40: all() -> 
   41:     [test1, test2, test3, test4, test5, testf, not_used,
   42:      in_guard, mem_leak, coerce_to_float, bjorn, append_empty_is_same,
   43:      huge_float_field, system_limit, badarg,
   44:      copy_writable_binary, kostis, dynamic, bs_add, otp_7422, zero_width,
   45:      bad_append, bs_append_overflow, bs_append_offheap,
   46:      reductions, fp16, error_info].
   47: 
   48: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   49:     Config.
   50: 
   51: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   52:     application:stop(os_mon).
   53: 
   54: big(1) ->
   55:     57285702734876389752897683.
   56: 
   57: i(X) -> X.
   58: 
   59: r(L) ->
   60:     lists:reverse(L).
   61: 
   62: -define(T(B, L), {B, ??B, L}).
   63: -define(N(B), {B, ??B, unknown}).
   64: 
   65: -define(FAIL(Expr), fail_check(catch Expr, ??Expr, [])).
   66: 
   67: -define(FAIL_VARS(Expr, Vars), fail_check(catch Expr, ??Expr, Vars)).
   68: 
   69: l(I_13, I_big1) ->
   70:     [
   71:      ?T(<<-43>>,
   72: 	[256-43]),
   73:      ?T(<<56>>,
   74: 	[56]),
   75:      ?T(<<1,2>>,
   76: 	[1, 2]),
   77:      ?T(<<4:4, 7:4>>,
   78: 	[4*16+7]),
   79:      ?T(<<777:16/big>>,
   80: 	[3, 9]),
   81:      ?T(<<777:16/little>>,
   82: 	[9, 3]),
   83:      ?T(<<0.0:32/float>>,
   84: 	[0,0,0,0]),
   85:      ?T(<<0.125:32/float>>,
   86: 	[62,0,0,0]),
   87:      ?T(<<0.125:32/little-float>>,
   88: 	[0,0,0,62]),
   89:      ?T(<<I_big1:32>>,
   90: 	[138, 99, 0, 147]),
   91:      ?T(<<57285702734876389752897684:32>>,
   92: 	[138, 99, 0, 148]),
   93:      ?T(<<I_big1:32/little>>,
   94: 	r([138, 99, 0, 147])),
   95:      ?T(<<-1:17/unit:8>>,
   96: 	lists:duplicate(17, 255)),
   97: 
   98:      ?T(<<I_13>>,
   99: 	[13]),
  100: 
  101:      ?T(<<4:8/unit:2,5:2/unit:8>>,
  102: 	[0, 4, 0, 5]),
  103: 
  104:      ?T(<<1:1, 0:6, 1:1>>,
  105: 	[129]),
  106:      ?T(<<1:1/little, 0:6/little, 1:1/little>>,
  107: 	[129]),
  108: 
  109:      ?T(<<<<1,2>>/binary>>,
  110: 	[1, 2]),
  111:      ?T(<<<<1,2>>:1/binary>>,
  112: 	[1]),
  113:      ?T(<<4,3,<<1,2>>:1/binary>>,
  114: 	[4,3,1]),
  115: 
  116:      ?T(<<(256*45+47)>>,
  117: 	[47]),
  118: 
  119:      ?T(<<57:0>>,
  120: 	[]),
  121: 
  122:      ?T(<<"apa">>,
  123: 	"apa"),
  124: 
  125:      ?T(<<1:3,"string",9:5>>,
  126: 	[46,110,142,77,45,204,233]),
  127: 
  128:      ?T(<<>>,
  129: 	[]),
  130: 
  131:      ?T(<<37.98:64/native-float>>,
  132: 	native_3798()),
  133: 
  134:      ?T(<<32978297842987249827298387697777669766334937:128/native-integer>>,
  135: 	native_bignum()),
  136: 
  137:      ?T(<<$э/native-utf16,$т/native-utf16,$о/native-utf16," спутник"/native-utf16>>,
  138:         native_utf16()),
  139: 
  140:      ?T(<<$в/native-utf32,"ода"/native-utf32>>,
  141: 	native_utf32()),
  142: 
  143:      %% Unit tests.
  144:      ?T(<<<<5:3>>/bitstring>>, <<5:3>>),
  145:      ?T(<<42,<<7:4>>/binary-unit:4>>, <<42,7:4>>),
  146:      ?T(<<<<344:17>>/binary-unit:17>>, <<344:17>>),
  147:      ?T(<<<<42,3,7656:16>>/binary-unit:16>>, <<42,3,7656:16>>)
  148: 
  149:      ].
  150: 
  151: native_3798() ->
  152:     case <<1:16/native>> of
  153: 	<<0,1>> -> [64,66,253,112,163,215,10,61];
  154: 	<<1,0>> -> [61,10,215,163,112,253,66,64]
  155:     end.
  156: 
  157: native_bignum() ->
  158:     case <<1:16/native>> of
  159: 	<<0,1>> -> [129,205,18,177,1,213,170,101,39,231,109,128,176,11,73,217];
  160: 	<<1,0>> -> [217,73,11,176,128,109,231,39,101,170,213,1,177,18,205,129]
  161:     end.
  162: 
  163: native_utf16() ->
  164:     case <<1:16/native>> of
  165: 	<<0,1>> -> [4,77,4,66,4,62,0,32,4,65,4,63,4,67,4,66,4,61,4,56,4,58];
  166:         <<1,0>> -> [77,4,66,4,62,4,32,0,65,4,63,4,67,4,66,4,61,4,56,4,58,4]
  167:     end.
  168: 
  169: native_utf32() ->
  170:     case <<1:16/native>> of
  171: 	<<0,1>> -> [0,0,4,50,0,0,4,62,0,0,4,52,0,0,4,48];
  172:         <<1,0>> -> [50,4,0,0,62,4,0,0,52,4,0,0,48,4,0,0]
  173:     end.
  174: 
  175: evaluate(Str, Vars) ->
  176:     {ok,Tokens,_} =
  177: 	erl_scan:string(Str ++ " . "),
  178:     {ok, [Expr]} = erl_parse:parse_exprs(Tokens),
  179:     case erl_eval:expr(Expr, Vars) of
  180: 	{value, Result, _} ->
  181: 	    Result
  182:     end.
  183: 
  184: eval_list([], _Vars) ->
  185:     [];
  186: eval_list([{C_bin, Str, Bytes} | Rest], Vars) ->
  187:     case catch evaluate(Str, Vars) of
  188: 	{'EXIT', Error} ->
  189: 	    io:format("Evaluation error: ~p, ~p, ~p~n", [Str, Vars, Error]),
  190: 	    exit(Error);
  191: 	E_bin ->
  192: 	    [{C_bin, E_bin, Str, Bytes} | eval_list(Rest, Vars)]
  193:     end.
  194: 
  195: one_test({C_bin, E_bin, Str, Bytes}) when is_list(Bytes) ->
  196:     io:format("  ~ts, ~p~n", [Str, Bytes]),
  197:     Bin = list_to_binary(Bytes),
  198:     if
  199: 	C_bin == Bin ->
  200: 	    ok;
  201: 	true ->
  202: 	    io:format("ERROR: Compiled: ~p.~nExpected ~p.~nGot ~p.~n",
  203: 		      [Str, Bytes, binary_to_list(C_bin)]),
  204: 	    ct:fail(comp)
  205:     end,
  206:     if
  207: 	E_bin == Bin ->
  208: 	    ok;
  209: 	true ->
  210: 	    io:format("ERROR: Interpreted: ~p.~nExpected ~p.~nGot ~p.~n",
  211: 		      [Str, Bytes, binary_to_list(E_bin)]),
  212: 	    ct:fail(comp)
  213:     end;
  214: one_test({C_bin, E_bin, Str, Result}) ->
  215:     io:format("  ~ts ~p~n", [Str, C_bin]),
  216:     if
  217: 	C_bin == E_bin ->
  218: 	    ok;
  219: 	true ->
  220: 	    Arbitrary = case Result of
  221: 			    unknown ->
  222: 				size(C_bin);
  223: 			    _ ->
  224: 				Result
  225: 			end,
  226: 	    case equal_lists(binary_to_list(C_bin),
  227: 			     binary_to_list(E_bin),
  228: 			     Arbitrary) of
  229: 		false ->
  230: 		    io:format("ERROR: Compiled not equal to interpreted:"
  231: 			      "~n ~p, ~p.~n",
  232: 			      [binary_to_list(C_bin), binary_to_list(E_bin)]),
  233: 		    ct:fail(comp);
  234: 		0 ->
  235: 		    ok;
  236: 		%% For situations where the final bits may not matter, like
  237: 		%% for floats:
  238: 		N when is_integer(N) ->
  239: 		    io:format("Info: compiled and interpreted differ in the"
  240: 			      " last bytes:~n ~p, ~p.~n",
  241: 			      [binary_to_list(C_bin), binary_to_list(E_bin)]),
  242: 		    ok
  243: 	    end
  244:     end.
  245: 
  246: equal_lists([], [], _) ->
  247:     0;
  248: equal_lists([], _, _) ->
  249:     false;
  250: equal_lists(_, [], _) ->
  251:     false;
  252: equal_lists([A|AR], [A|BR], R) ->
  253:     equal_lists(AR, BR, R);
  254: equal_lists(A, B, R) ->
  255:     if
  256: 	length(A) /= length(B) ->
  257: 	    false;
  258: 	length(A) =< R ->
  259: 	    R;
  260: 	true ->
  261: 	    false
  262:     end.
  263: 
  264: fail_check({'EXIT',{badarg,_}}, Str, Vars) ->
  265:     try	evaluate(Str, Vars) of
  266: 	Res ->
  267: 	    io:format("Interpreted result: ~p", [Res]),
  268: 	    ct:fail(did_not_fail_in_intepreted_code)
  269:     catch
  270: 	error:badarg ->
  271: 	    ok
  272:     end;
  273: fail_check(Res, _, _) ->
  274:     io:format("Compiled result: ~p", [Res]),
  275:     ct:fail(did_not_fail_in_compiled_code).
  276: 
  277: %%% Simple working cases
  278: test1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  279:     I_13 = i(13),
  280:     I_big1 = big(1),
  281:     Vars = [{'I_13', I_13},
  282: 		  {'I_big1', I_big1}],
  283:     lists:foreach(fun one_test/1, eval_list(l(I_13, I_big1), Vars)).
  284: 
  285: %%% Misc
  286: 
  287: %%% <<A:S, A:(N-S)>>
  288: comp(N, A, S) ->
  289:     M1 = (1 bsl S) - 1,
  290:     M2 = (1 bsl (N-S)) - 1,
  291:     [((A band M1) bsl (N-S)) bor (A band M2)].
  292: 
  293: gen(N, S, A) ->
  294:     [?T(<<A:S, A:(N-S)>>, comp(N, A, S))].
  295: 
  296: gen_l(N, S, A) ->
  297:     [?T(<<A:S/little, A:(N-S)/little>>, comp(N, A, S))].
  298: 
  299: test2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  300:     test2(0, 8, 2#10101010101010101),
  301:     test2(0, 8, 2#1111111111).
  302: 
  303: test2(End, End, _) ->
  304:     ok;
  305: test2(I, End, A) ->
  306:     test2(I, A),
  307:     test2(I+1, End, A).
  308: 
  309: test2(S, A) ->
  310:     N = 8,
  311:     Vars = [{'A',A}, {'N',N}, {'S',S}],
  312:     io:format("Vars: ~p\n", [Vars]),
  313:     lists:foreach(fun one_test/1, eval_list(gen(N, S, A), Vars)),
  314:     lists:foreach(fun one_test/1, eval_list(gen_l(N, S, A), Vars)).
  315: 
  316: %%% Tests without facit
  317: 
  318: t3() ->
  319:     [?N(<<4711:13, 9876:13, 3:6>>),
  320:      ?N(<<4.57:64/float>>),
  321:      ?N(<<4.57:32/float>>),
  322: 
  323:      ?N(<<>>)
  324:     ].
  325: 
  326: test3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  327:     Vars = [],
  328:     lists:foreach(fun one_test/1, eval_list(t3(), Vars)).
  329: 
  330: gen_u(N, S, A) ->
  331:     [?N(<<A:S, A:(N-S)>>)].
  332: 
  333: gen_u_l(N, S, A) ->
  334:     [?N(<<A:S/little, A:(N-S)/little>>)].
  335: 
  336: test4(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  337:     test4(0, 16, 2#10101010101010101),
  338:     test4(0, 16, 2#1111111111).
  339: 
  340: test4(End, End, _) ->
  341:     ok;
  342: test4(I, End, A) ->
  343:     test4(I, A),
  344:     test4(I+1, End, A).
  345: 
  346: test4(S, A) ->
  347:     N = 16,
  348:     Vars = [{'A', A}, {'N', 16}, {'S', S}],
  349:     lists:foreach(fun one_test/1, eval_list(gen_u(N, S, A), Vars)),
  350:     lists:foreach(fun one_test/1, eval_list(gen_u_l(N, S, A), Vars)).
  351: 
  352: gen_b(N, S, A) ->
  353:     [?T(<<A:S/binary-unit:1, A:(N-S)/binary-unit:1>>,
  354: 	binary_to_list(<<A:S/binary-unit:1, A:(N-S)/binary-unit:1>>))].
  355: 
  356: %% OTP-3995
  357: test5(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  358:     test5(0, 8, <<73>>),
  359:     test5(0, 8, <<68>>).
  360: 
  361: test5(End, End, _) ->
  362:     ok;
  363: test5(I, End, A) ->
  364:     test5(I, A),
  365:     test5(I+1, End, A).
  366: 
  367: test5(S, A) ->
  368:     N = 8,
  369:     Vars = [{'A', A}, {'N', 8}, {'S', S}],
  370:     lists:foreach(fun one_test/1, eval_list(gen_b(N, S, A), Vars)).
  371: 
  372: %%% Failure cases
  373: testf(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  374:     ?FAIL(<<3.14>>),
  375:     ?FAIL(<<<<1,2>>>>),
  376: 
  377:     ?FAIL(<<2.71/binary>>),
  378:     ?FAIL(<<24334/binary>>),
  379:     ?FAIL(<<24334344294788947129487129487219847/binary>>),
  380:     BigInt = id(24334344294788947129487129487219847),
  381:     ?FAIL_VARS(<<BigInt/binary>>, [{'BigInt',BigInt}]),
  382:     ?FAIL_VARS(<<42,BigInt/binary>>, [{'BigInt',BigInt}]),
  383:     ?FAIL_VARS(<<BigInt:2/binary>>, [{'BigInt',BigInt}]),
  384: 
  385:     %% One negative field size, but the sum of field sizes will be 1 byte.
  386:     %% Make sure that we reject that properly.
  387:     I_minus_777 = id(-777),
  388:     I_minus_2047 = id(-2047),
  389:     ?FAIL_VARS(<<I_minus_777:2048/unit:8,57:I_minus_2047/unit:8>>,
  390: 		     ordsets:from_list([{'I_minus_777',I_minus_777},
  391: 					{'I_minus_2047',I_minus_2047}])),
  392:     ?FAIL(<<<<1,2,3>>/float>>),
  393: 
  394:     %% Negative field widths.
  395:     testf_1(-8, <<1,2,3,4,5>>),
  396:     ?FAIL(<<0:(-(1 bsl 100))>>),
  397: 
  398:     ?FAIL(<<42:(-16)>>),
  399:     ?FAIL(<<3.14:(-8)/float>>),
  400:     ?FAIL(<<<<23,56,0,2>>:(-16)/binary>>),
  401:     ?FAIL(<<<<23,56,0,2>>:(2.5)/binary>>),
  402:     ?FAIL(<<<<23,56,0,2>>:(anka)>>),
  403:     ?FAIL(<<<<23,56,0,2>>:(anka)>>),
  404: 
  405:     %% Unit failures.
  406:     ?FAIL(<<<<1:1>>/binary>>),
  407:     Sz = id(1),
  408:     ?FAIL_VARS(<<<<1:Sz>>/binary>>, [{'Sz',Sz}]),
  409:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch <<<<1:(id(1))>>/binary>>),
  410:     ?FAIL(<<<<7,8,9>>/binary-unit:16>>),
  411:     ?FAIL(<<<<7,8,9,3:7>>/binary-unit:16>>),
  412:     ?FAIL(<<<<7,8,9,3:7>>/binary-unit:17>>),
  413: 
  414:     ok.
  415: 
  416: testf_1(W, B) ->
  417:     Vars = [{'W',W}],
  418:     ?FAIL_VARS(<<42:W>>, Vars),
  419:     ?FAIL_VARS(<<3.14:W/float>>, Vars),
  420:     ?FAIL_VARS(<<B:W/binary>>, [{'B',B}|Vars]).
  421: 
  422: %% Test that constructed binaries that are not used will still give an exception.
  423: not_used(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  424:     ok = not_used1(3, <<"dum">>),
  425:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch not_used1(3, "dum")),
  426:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch not_used2(444, -2)),
  427:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch not_used2(444, anka)),
  428:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch not_used3(444)),
  429:     ok.
  430: 
  431: not_used1(I, BinString) ->
  432:     <<I:32,BinString/binary>>,
  433:     ok.
  434: 
  435: not_used2(I, Sz) ->
  436:     <<I:Sz>>,
  437:     ok.
  438: 
  439: not_used3(I) ->
  440:     <<I:(-8)>>,
  441:     ok.
  442: 
  443: in_guard(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  444:     1 = in_guard(<<16#74ad:16>>, 16#e95, 5),
  445:     2 = in_guard(<<16#3A,16#F7,"hello">>, 16#3AF7, <<"hello">>),
  446:     3 = in_guard(<<16#FBCD:14,3.1415/float,3:2>>, 16#FBCD, 3.1415),
  447:     3 = in_guard(<<16#FBCD:14,3/float,3:2>>, 16#FBCD, 3),
  448:     3 = in_guard(<<16#FBCD:14,(2 bsl 226)/float,3:2>>, 16#FBCD, 2 bsl 226),
  449:     nope = in_guard(<<1>>, 42, b),
  450:     nope = in_guard(<<1>>, a, b),
  451:     nope = in_guard(<<1,2>>, 1, 1),
  452:     nope = in_guard(<<4,5>>, 1, 2.71),
  453:     nope = in_guard(<<4,5>>, 1, <<12,13>>),
  454:     ok.
  455: 
  456: in_guard(Bin, A, B) when <<A:13,B:3>> == Bin -> 1;
  457: in_guard(Bin, A, B) when <<A:16,B/binary>> == Bin -> 2;
  458: in_guard(Bin, A, B) when <<A:14,B/float,3:2>> == Bin -> 3;
  459: in_guard(Bin, A, B) when {a,b,<<A:14,B/float,3:2>>} == Bin -> cant_happen;
  460: in_guard(_, _, _) -> nope.
  461: 
  462: %% Make sure that construction has no memory leak
  463: mem_leak(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  464:     B = make_bin(16, <<0>>),
  465:     mem_leak(1024, B),
  466:     ok.
  467: 
  468: mem_leak(0, _) -> ok;
  469: mem_leak(N, B) ->
  470:     big_bin(B, <<23>>),
  471:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch big_bin(B, bad)),
  472:     mem_leak(N-1, B).
  473: 
  474: big_bin(B1, B2) ->
  475:     <<B1/binary,B1/binary,B1/binary,B1/binary,
  476:       B1/binary,B1/binary,B1/binary,B1/binary,
  477:       B1/binary,B1/binary,B1/binary,B1/binary,
  478:       B1/binary,B1/binary,B1/binary,B1/binary,
  479:       B2/binary>>.
  480:     
  481: make_bin(0, Acc) -> Acc;
  482: make_bin(N, Acc) -> make_bin(N-1, <<Acc/binary,Acc/binary>>).
  483: 
  484: -define(COF(Int0),
  485: 	(fun(Int) ->
  486: 		 true = <<Int:16/float>> =:= <<(float(Int)):16/float>>,
  487: 		 true = <<Int:32/float>> =:= <<(float(Int)):32/float>>,
  488: 		 true = <<Int:64/float>> =:= <<(float(Int)):64/float>>
  489: 	 end)(nonliteral(Int0)),
  490: 	true = <<Int0:16/float>> =:= <<(float(Int0)):16/float>>,
  491: 	true = <<Int0:32/float>> =:= <<(float(Int0)):32/float>>,
  492: 	true = <<Int0:64/float>> =:= <<(float(Int0)):64/float>>).
  493: 
  494: -define(COF32(Int0),
  495: 	(fun(Int) ->
  496: 		 true = <<Int:32/float>> =:= <<(float(Int)):32/float>>,
  497: 		 true = <<Int:64/float>> =:= <<(float(Int)):64/float>>
  498: 	 end)(nonliteral(Int0)),
  499: 	true = <<Int0:32/float>> =:= <<(float(Int0)):32/float>>,
  500: 	true = <<Int0:64/float>> =:= <<(float(Int0)):64/float>>).
  501: 
  502: -define(COF64(Int0),
  503: 	(fun(Int) ->
  504: 		 true = <<Int:64/float>> =:= <<(float(Int)):64/float>>
  505: 	 end)(nonliteral(Int0)),
  506: 	true = <<Int0:64/float>> =:= <<(float(Int0)):64/float>>).
  507: 
  508: nonliteral(X) -> X.
  509:     
  510: coerce_to_float(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  511:     ?COF(0),
  512:     ?COF(-1),
  513:     ?COF(1),
  514:     ?COF(42),
  515:     ?COF(255),
  516:     ?COF(-255),
  517:     ?COF(38474),
  518:     ?COF(65504),
  519:     ?COF(-65504),
  520:     ?COF32(387498738948729893849444444443),
  521:     ?COF32(-37489378937773899999999999999993),
  522:     ?COF64(298748888888888888888888888883478264866528467367364766666666666666663),
  523:     ?COF64(-367546729879999999999947826486652846736736476555566666663),
  524:     ok.
  525: 
  526: bjorn(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  527:     error = bjorn_1(),
  528:     ok.
  529: 
  530: bjorn_1() ->
  531:     Bitstr = <<7:13>>,
  532:     try
  533: 	do_something()
  534:     catch
  535: 	throw:blurf ->
  536: 	    ignore
  537:     end,
  538:     do_more(Bitstr, 13).
  539: 
  540: do_more(Bin, Sz) ->
  541:     %% Previous bug in the bs_bits_to_bytes instruction: The exeption code
  542:     %% was not set - the previous exception (throw:blurf) would be used,
  543:     %% causing the catch to slip.
  544:     try <<Bin:Sz/binary>> of
  545: 	_V -> ok
  546:     catch
  547: 	error:_ ->
  548: 	    error
  549:     end.
  550: 
  551: do_something() ->
  552:     throw(blurf).
  553: 
  554: append_empty_is_same(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  555:     NonWritableBin = <<"123">>,
  556:     true = erts_debug:same(NonWritableBin, append(NonWritableBin, <<>>)),
  557:     WritableBin = <<(id(<<>>))/binary,0,1,2,3,4,5,6,7>>,
  558:     true = erts_debug:same(WritableBin, append(WritableBin, <<>>)),
  559:     ok.
  560: 
  561: append(A, B) ->
  562:     <<A/binary, B/binary>>.
  563: 
  564: huge_float_field(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  565:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch <<0.0:9/float-unit:8>>),
  566:     huge_float_check(catch <<0.0:67108865/float-unit:64>>),
  567:     huge_float_check(catch <<0.0:((1 bsl 26)+1)/float-unit:64>>),
  568:     huge_float_check(catch <<0.0:(id(67108865))/float-unit:64>>),
  569: %%  huge_float_check(catch <<0.0:((1 bsl 60)+1)/float-unit:64>>),
  570:     huge_float_check(catch <<3839739387439387383739387987347983:((1 bsl 26)+1)/float-unit:64>>),
  571: %%  huge_float_check(catch <<3839739387439387383739387987347983:((1 bsl 60)+1)/float-unit:64>>),
  572:     ok.
  573: 
  574: huge_float_check({'EXIT',{system_limit,_}}) -> ok;
  575: huge_float_check({'EXIT',{badarg,_}}) -> ok.
  576: 
  577: system_limit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  578:     WordSize = erlang:system_info(wordsize),
  579:     BitsPerWord = WordSize * 8,
  580:     {'EXIT',{system_limit,_}} =
  581: 	(catch <<0:(id(0)),42:(id(1 bsl BitsPerWord))>>),
  582:     {'EXIT',{system_limit,_}} =
  583: 	(catch <<42:(id(1 bsl BitsPerWord)),0:(id(0))>>),
  584:     {'EXIT',{system_limit,_}} =
  585: 	(catch <<(id(<<>>))/binary,0:(id(1 bsl 100))>>),
  586: 
  587:     %% Would fail to load.
  588:     {'EXIT',{system_limit,_}} = (catch <<0:(1 bsl 67)>>),
  589:     {'EXIT',{system_limit,_}} = (catch <<0:((1 bsl 64)+1)>>),
  590: 
  591:     case WordSize of
  592: 	4 ->
  593: 	    system_limit_32();
  594: 	8 ->
  595: 	    ok
  596:     end.
  597: 
  598: system_limit_32() ->
  599:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch <<42:(-1)>>),
  600:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch <<42:(id(-1))>>),
  601:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch <<42:(id(-389739873536870912))/unit:8>>),
  602:     {'EXIT',{system_limit,_}} = (catch <<42:536870912/unit:8>>),
  603:     {'EXIT',{system_limit,_}} = (catch <<42:(id(536870912))/unit:8>>),
  604:     {'EXIT',{system_limit,_}} = (catch <<0:(id(8)),42:536870912/unit:8>>),
  605:     {'EXIT',{system_limit,_}} = (catch <<0:(id(8)),42:(id(536870912))/unit:8>>),
  606: 
  607:     %% The size would be silently truncated, resulting in a crash.
  608:     {'EXIT',{system_limit,_}} = (catch <<0:(1 bsl 35)>>),
  609:     {'EXIT',{system_limit,_}} = (catch <<0:((1 bsl 32)+1)>>),
  610: 
  611:     %% Would fail to load.
  612:     {'EXIT',{system_limit,_}} = (catch <<0:(1 bsl 43)>>),
  613:     {'EXIT',{system_limit,_}} = (catch <<0:((1 bsl 40)+1)>>),
  614:     ok.
  615: 
  616: badarg(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  617:     <<3:2>> = <<1:(id(1)),1:(id(1))>>,
  618:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch <<0:(id(1)),0:(id(-1))>>),
  619:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch <<0:(id(1)),0:(id(-(1 bsl 70)))>>),
  620:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch <<0:(id(-(1 bsl 70))),0:(id(1))>>),
  621:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch <<(id(<<>>))/binary,0:(id(-(1)))>>),
  622:     ok.
  623: 
  624: copy_writable_binary(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  625:     [copy_writable_binary_1(I) || I <- lists:seq(0, 256)],
  626:     ok.
  627: 
  628: copy_writable_binary_1(_) ->
  629:     Bin0 = <<(id(<<>>))/binary,0,1,2,3,4,5,6,7>>,
  630:     SubBin = make_sub_bin(Bin0),
  631:     id(<<42,34,55,Bin0/binary>>),		%Make reallocation likelier.
  632:     Pid = spawn(fun() ->
  633: 			      copy_writable_binary_holder(Bin0, SubBin)
  634: 		      end),
  635:     Tab = ets:new(holder, []),
  636:     ets:insert(Tab, {17,Bin0}),
  637:     ets:insert(Tab, {42,SubBin}),
  638:     id(<<Bin0/binary,0:(64*1024*8)>>),
  639:     Pid ! self(),
  640:     [{17,Bin0}] = ets:lookup(Tab, 17),
  641:     [{42,Bin0}] = ets:lookup(Tab, 42),
  642:     receive
  643: 	{Pid,Bin0,Bin0} -> ok;
  644: 	Other ->
  645: 	    ct:fail("Unexpected message: ~p", [Other])
  646:     end,
  647:     ok.
  648: 
  649: copy_writable_binary_holder(Bin, SubBin) ->
  650:     receive
  651: 	Pid ->
  652: 	    Pid ! {self(),Bin,SubBin}
  653:     end.
  654: 
  655: make_sub_bin(Bin0) ->
  656:     N = bit_size(Bin0),
  657:     <<_:17,Bin:N/bitstring,_:5>> = <<(-1):17,Bin0/bitstring,(-1):5>>,
  658:     Bin = Bin0,					%Assertion.
  659:     Bin.
  660: 
  661: %% Make sure that bit syntax expression with huge field size are
  662: %% not constructed at compile time.
  663: 
  664: kostis(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  665:     case have_250_terabytes_of_ram() of
  666: 	true ->
  667: 	    Bin = <<0:800000000000>>,
  668: 	    EmbeddedBin = <<0,(<<0:99999999999>>)/bitstring,1>>,
  669: 	    Bin0 = list_to_binary([Bin,Bin,Bin,Bin,Bin]),
  670: 	    Bin1 = list_to_binary([Bin0,Bin0,Bin0,Bin0,Bin0,Bin0]),
  671: 	    Bin2 = list_to_binary([Bin1,Bin1]),
  672: 	    id({EmbeddedBin,Bin0,Bin1,Bin2});
  673: 	false ->
  674: 	    ok
  675:     end.
  676: 
  677: %% I'm not even certain how much 250 TB really is...
  678: %% but I'm sure I don't have it :-)
  679: 
  680: have_250_terabytes_of_ram() -> false.
  681: 
  682: %% Test that different ways of using bit syntax instructions
  683: %% give the same result.
  684: 
  685: dynamic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  686:     dynamic_1(fun dynamic_big/5),
  687:     dynamic_1(fun dynamic_little/5),
  688:     ok.
  689: 		      
  690: dynamic_1(Dynamic) ->
  691:     <<Lpad:128>> = erlang:md5([0]),
  692:     <<Rpad:128>> = erlang:md5([1]),
  693:     <<Int:128>> = erlang:md5([2]),
  694:     8385 = dynamic_2(0, {Int,Lpad,Rpad,Dynamic}, 0).
  695: 
  696: dynamic_2(129, _, Count) -> Count;
  697: dynamic_2(Bef, Data, Count0) ->
  698:     Count = dynamic_3(Bef, 128-Bef, Data, Count0),
  699:     dynamic_2(Bef+1, Data, Count).
  700: 
  701: dynamic_3(_, -1, _, Count) -> Count;
  702: dynamic_3(Bef, N, {Int0,Lpad,Rpad,Dynamic}=Data, Count) ->
  703:     Int1 = Int0 band ((1 bsl (N+3))-1),
  704:     Dynamic(Bef, N, Int1, Lpad, Rpad),
  705:     Dynamic(Bef, N, -Int1, Lpad, Rpad),
  706: 
  707:     %% OTP-7085: Test a small number in a wide field.
  708:     Int2 = Int0 band 16#FFFFFF,
  709:     Dynamic(Bef, N, Int2, Lpad, Rpad),
  710:     Dynamic(Bef, N, -Int2, Lpad, Rpad),
  711:     dynamic_3(Bef, N-1, Data, Count+1).
  712: 
  713: dynamic_big(Bef, N, Int, Lpad, Rpad) ->
  714:     NumBin = id(<<Int:N>>),
  715:     MaskedInt = Int band ((1 bsl N) - 1),
  716:     <<MaskedInt:N>> = NumBin,
  717: 
  718:     %% Construct the binary in two different ways.
  719:     Bin = id(<<Lpad:Bef,NumBin/bitstring,Rpad:(128-Bef-N)>>),
  720:     Bin = <<Lpad:Bef,Int:N,Rpad:(128-Bef-N)>>,
  721: 
  722:     %% Further verify the result by matching.
  723:     LpadMasked = Lpad band ((1 bsl Bef) - 1),
  724:     RpadMasked = Rpad band ((1 bsl (128-Bef-N)) - 1),
  725:     Rbits = (128-Bef-N),
  726:     <<LpadMasked:Bef,MaskedInt:N,RpadMasked:Rbits>> = id(Bin),
  727:     ok.
  728: 
  729: dynamic_little(Bef, N, Int, Lpad, Rpad) ->
  730:     NumBin = id(<<Int:N/little>>),
  731:     MaskedInt = Int band ((1 bsl N) - 1),
  732:     <<MaskedInt:N/little>> = NumBin,
  733: 
  734:     %% Construct the binary in two different ways.
  735:     Bin = id(<<Lpad:Bef/little,NumBin/bitstring,Rpad:(128-Bef-N)/little>>),
  736:     Bin = <<Lpad:Bef/little,Int:N/little,Rpad:(128-Bef-N)/little>>,
  737: 
  738:     %% Further verify the result by matching.
  739:     LpadMasked = Lpad band ((1 bsl Bef) - 1),
  740:     RpadMasked = Rpad band ((1 bsl (128-Bef-N)) - 1),
  741:     Rbits = (128-Bef-N),
  742:     <<LpadMasked:Bef/little,MaskedInt:N/little,RpadMasked:Rbits/little>> = id(Bin),
  743:     ok.
  744: 
  745: %% Test that the bs_add/5 instruction handles big numbers correctly.
  746: bs_add(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  747:     Mod = bs_construct_bs_add,
  748:     N = 2000,
  749:     Code = [{module, Mod},
  750: 	    {exports, [{bs_add,2}]},
  751: 	    {labels, 2},
  752: 
  753: 	    %% bs_add(Number, -SmallestBig) -> Number + N
  754: 	    {function, bs_add, 2, 2},
  755: 	    {label,1},
  756: 	    {func_info,{atom,Mod},{atom,bs_add},2},
  757: 
  758: 	    {label,2},
  759: 	    {move,{x,0},{x,2}}] ++
  760: 	lists:duplicate(N-1, {bs_add,{f,0},[{x,2},{integer,1},1],{x,2}}) ++
  761: 	[{gc_bif,abs,{f,0},3,[{x,1}],{x,4}},	%Force GC, ignore result.
  762: 	 {gc_bif,'+',{f,0},3,[{x,2},{integer,1}],{x,0}}, %Safe result in {x,0}
  763: 	 return],
  764: 
  765:     %% Write assembly file and assemble it.
  766:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  767:     RootName = filename:join(PrivDir, atom_to_list(Mod)),
  768:     AsmFile = RootName ++ ".S",
  769:     {ok,Fd} = file:open(AsmFile, [write]),
  770:     [io:format(Fd, "~p. \n", [T]) || T <- Code],
  771:     ok = file:close(Fd),
  772:     {ok,Mod} = compile:file(AsmFile, [from_asm,report,{outdir,PrivDir}]),
  773:     LoadRc = code:load_abs(RootName),
  774:     {module,_Module} = LoadRc,
  775: 
  776:     %% Find smallest positive bignum.
  777:     SmallestBig = smallest_big(),
  778:     io:format("~p\n", [SmallestBig]),
  779:     DoTest = fun() ->
  780: 		     exit(Mod:bs_add(SmallestBig, -SmallestBig))
  781: 	     end,
  782:     {Pid,Mref} = spawn_monitor(DoTest),
  783:     receive
  784: 	{'DOWN',Mref,process,Pid,Res} -> ok
  785:     end,
  786: 
  787:     case erlang:system_info(wordsize) of
  788:         8 ->
  789:             %% bignum-sized binaries must system_limit on 64-bit platforms
  790:             {system_limit, _} = Res;
  791:         4 ->
  792:             Res = SmallestBig + N
  793:     end,
  794: 
  795:     %% Clean up.
  796:     ok = file:delete(AsmFile),
  797:     ok = file:delete(code:which(Mod)),
  798:     ok.
  799: 
  800:      
  801: smallest_big() ->
  802:     smallest_big_1(1 bsl 24).
  803: 
  804: smallest_big_1(N) ->
  805:     case erts_debug:flat_size(N) of
  806: 	0 -> smallest_big_1(N+N);
  807: 	_  -> N
  808:     end.
  809: 
  810: otp_7422(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  811:     otp_7422_int(0),
  812:     otp_7422_bin(0).
  813: 
  814: otp_7422_int(N) when N < 512 ->
  815:     T = erlang:make_tuple(N, []),
  816:     spawn_link(fun() ->
  817: 		       id(T),
  818: 		       %% A size of field 0 would write one byte beyond
  819: 		       %% the current position in the binary. It could
  820: 		       %% overwrite the continuation pointer stored on
  821: 		       %% the stack if HTOP was equal to E (the stack pointer).
  822: 		       id(<<0:(id(0))>>)
  823: 	       end),
  824:     otp_7422_int(N+1);
  825: otp_7422_int(_) -> ok.
  826: 
  827: otp_7422_bin(N) when N < 512 ->
  828:     T = erlang:make_tuple(N, []),
  829:     Z = id(<<>>),
  830:     spawn_link(fun() ->
  831: 		       id(T),
  832: 		       id(<<Z:(id(0))/bits>>)
  833: 	       end),
  834:     otp_7422_bin(N+1);
  835: otp_7422_bin(_) -> ok.
  836: 
  837: zero_width(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  838:     Z = id(0),
  839:     Small = id(42),
  840:     Big = id(1 bsl 128),
  841:     <<>> = <<Small:Z>>,
  842:     <<>> = <<Small:0>>,
  843:     <<>> = <<Big:Z>>,
  844:     <<>> = <<Big:0>>,
  845:     
  846:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch <<not_a_number:0>>),
  847:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch <<(id(not_a_number)):Z>>),
  848:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch <<(id(not_a_number)):0>>),
  849: 
  850:     ok.
  851: 
  852: bad_append(_) ->
  853:     do_bad_append(<<127:1>>, fun append_unit_3/1),
  854:     do_bad_append(<<127:2>>, fun append_unit_3/1),
  855:     do_bad_append(<<127:17>>, fun append_unit_3/1),
  856: 
  857:     do_bad_append(<<127:3>>, fun append_unit_4/1),
  858:     do_bad_append(<<127:5>>, fun append_unit_4/1),
  859:     do_bad_append(<<127:7>>, fun append_unit_4/1),
  860:     do_bad_append(<<127:199>>, fun append_unit_4/1),
  861: 
  862:     do_bad_append(<<127:7>>, fun append_unit_8/1),
  863:     do_bad_append(<<127:9>>, fun append_unit_8/1),
  864: 
  865:     do_bad_append(<<0:8>>, fun append_unit_16/1),
  866:     do_bad_append(<<0:15>>, fun append_unit_16/1),
  867:     do_bad_append(<<0:17>>, fun append_unit_16/1),
  868:     ok.
  869: 
  870: do_bad_append(Bin0, Appender) ->
  871:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch Appender(Bin0)),
  872: 
  873:     Bin1 = id(<<0:3,Bin0/bitstring>>),
  874:     <<_:3,Bin2/bitstring>> = Bin1,
  875:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch Appender(Bin2)),
  876: 
  877:     %% Create a writable binary.
  878:     Empty = id(<<>>),
  879:     Bin3 = <<Empty/bitstring,Bin0/bitstring>>,
  880:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch Appender(Bin3)),
  881:     ok.
  882: 
  883: append_unit_3(Bin) ->
  884:     <<Bin/binary-unit:3,0:1>>.
  885: 
  886: append_unit_4(Bin) ->
  887:     <<Bin/binary-unit:4,0:1>>.
  888: 
  889: append_unit_8(Bin) ->
  890:     <<Bin/binary,0:1>>.
  891: 
  892: append_unit_16(Bin) ->
  893:     <<Bin/binary-unit:16,0:1>>.
  894: 
  895: %% Test that the bs_append instruction will correctly check for
  896: %% overflow by producing a binary whose total size would exceed the
  897: %% maximum allowed size for a binary on a 32-bit computer.
  898: 
  899: bs_append_overflow(_Config) ->
  900:     Memsize = memsize(),
  901:     io:format("Memsize = ~w Bytes~n", [Memsize]),
  902:     case erlang:system_info(wordsize) of
  903: 	8 ->
  904:             %% Not possible to test on a 64-bit computer.
  905: 	    {skip, "64-bit architecture"};
  906:         _ when Memsize < (2 bsl 30) ->
  907: 	    {skip, "Less than 2 GB of memory"};
  908: 	4 ->
  909:             {'EXIT', {system_limit, _}} = (catch bs_append_overflow_signed()),
  910:             erlang:garbage_collect(),
  911:             {'EXIT', {system_limit, _}} = (catch bs_append_overflow_unsigned()),
  912:             erlang:garbage_collect(),
  913: 	    ok
  914:     end.
  915: 
  916: bs_append_overflow_signed() ->
  917:     %% Produce a large binary that, if cast to signed int, would
  918:     %% overflow into a negative number that fits a smallnum.
  919:     Large = <<0:((1 bsl 30)-1)>>,
  920:     <<Large/bits, Large/bits, Large/bits, Large/bits,
  921:       Large/bits, Large/bits, Large/bits, Large/bits,
  922:       Large/bits>>.
  923: 
  924: bs_append_overflow_unsigned() ->
  925:     %% The following would succeed but would produce an incorrect result
  926:     %% where B =:= C!
  927:     A = <<0:((1 bsl 32)-8)>>,
  928:     B = <<2, 3>>,
  929:     C = <<A/binary,1,B/binary>>,
  930:     true = byte_size(B) < byte_size(C).
  931: 
  932: bs_append_offheap(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  933:     %% test that erts_bs_private_append is reflected correctly in
  934:     %%  process_info(Pid, binary()) report for off-heap binaries.
  935:     {Pid, MRef} = erlang:spawn_monitor(fun bs_append_offheap_proc/0),
  936:     receive
  937:         {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, normal} ->
  938:             ok;
  939:         {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, {{badmatch,[{binary,[]}]}, _}} ->
  940:             {fail, "missing binary in erts_bs_private_append"}
  941:     end.
  942: 
  943: bs_append_offheap_proc() ->
  944:     Self = self(),
  945:     Len = 128,
  946:     OffHeapBin = list_to_binary(lists:duplicate(Len, $b)),
  947:     erlang:garbage_collect(Self),
  948:     [{binary, [{_, Len, 1}]}] = erlang:process_info(Self, [binary]),
  949:     Bin = <<OffHeapBin/binary, "a">>,
  950:     erlang:garbage_collect(Self),
  951:     %% expect a single binary (2 bytes longer than the original)
  952:     [{binary, [{_, _, 1}]}] = erlang:process_info(Self, [binary]),
  953:     Bin.
  954: 
  955: reductions(_Config) ->
  956:     TwoMeg = <<0:(2_000*1024)/unit:8>>,
  957:     reds_at_least(2000, fun() -> <<0:8,TwoMeg/binary>> end),
  958:     reds_at_least(4000, fun() -> <<0:8,TwoMeg/binary,TwoMeg/binary>> end),
  959:     reds_at_least(1000, fun() -> <<0:8,TwoMeg:(1000*1024)/binary>> end),
  960: 
  961:     %% Here we expect about 500 reductions in the bs_append
  962:     %% instruction for setting up a writable binary and about 2000
  963:     %% reductions in the bs_put_binary instruction for copying the
  964:     %% binary data.
  965:     reds_at_least(2500, fun() -> <<TwoMeg/binary,TwoMeg:(2000*1024)/binary>> end),
  966:     ok.
  967: 
  968: reds_at_least(N, Fun) ->
  969:     receive after 1 -> ok end,
  970:     {reductions,Red0} = process_info(self(), reductions),
  971:     _ = Fun(),
  972:     {reductions,Red1} = process_info(self(), reductions),
  973:     Diff = Red1 - Red0,
  974:     io:format("Expected at least ~p; got ~p\n", [N,Diff]),
  975:     if
  976:         Diff >= N ->
  977:             ok;
  978:         Diff ->
  979:             ct:fail({expected,N,got,Diff})
  980:     end.
  981: memsize() ->
  982:     application:ensure_all_started(os_mon),
  983:     case proplists:get_value(available_memory, memsup:get_system_memory_data()) of
  984:         undefined ->
  985:             {Tot,_Used,_}  = memsup:get_memory_data(),
  986:             Tot;
  987:         Available ->
  988:             Available
  989:     end.
  990: 
  991: -define(FP16(EncodedInt, Float),
  992:         (fun(NlInt, NlFloat) ->
  993:                  {0, true} = {0, <<NlInt:16>> =:= <<NlFloat:16/float>>},
  994:                  {1, true} = {1, <<(NlInt+16#8000):16>> =:= <<-NlFloat:16/float>>},
  995:                  {2, true} = {2, <<NlInt:16/little>> =:= <<NlFloat:16/float-little>>},
  996:                  {3, true} = {3, <<(NlInt+16#8000):16/little>> =:= <<-NlFloat:16/float-little>>},
  997:                  {4, true} = {4, <<NlInt:16/native>> =:= <<NlFloat:16/float-native>>},
  998:                  {5, true} = {5, <<(NlInt+16#8000):16/native>> =:= <<-NlFloat:16/float-native>>}
  999:          end)(nonliteral(EncodedInt), nonliteral(Float)),
 1000:         {a, true} = {a, <<EncodedInt:16>> =:= <<Float:16/float>>},
 1001:         {b, true} = {b, <<(EncodedInt+16#8000):16>> =:= <<-Float:16/float>>},
 1002:         {c, true} = {c, <<EncodedInt:16/little>> =:= <<Float:16/float-little>>},
 1003:         {d, true} = {d, <<(EncodedInt+16#8000):16/little>> =:= <<-Float:16/float-little>>},
 1004:         {e, true} = {e, <<EncodedInt:16/native>> =:= <<Float:16/float-native>>},
 1005:         {f, true} = {f, <<(EncodedInt+16#8000):16/native>> =:= <<-Float:16/float-native>>}).
 1006: 
 1007: fp16(_Config) ->
 1008:     %% smallest positive subnormal number
 1009:     ?FP16(16#0001, 0.000000059604645),
 1010:     %% largest positive subnormal number
 1011:     ?FP16(16#03ff, 0.000060975552),
 1012:     %% smallest positive normal number
 1013:     ?FP16(16#0400, 0.00006103515625),
 1014:     %% largest normal number
 1015:     ?FP16(16#7bff, 65504),
 1016:     ?FP16(16#7bff, 65504.0),
 1017:     %% largest number less than one
 1018:     ?FP16(16#3bff, 0.99951172),
 1019:     %% zero
 1020:     ?FP16(16#0000, 0.0),
 1021:     %% one
 1022:     ?FP16(16#3c00, 1),
 1023:     ?FP16(16#3c00, 1.0),
 1024:     %% smallest number larger than one
 1025:     ?FP16(16#3c01, 1.00097656),
 1026:     %% rounding of 1/3 to nearest
 1027:     ?FP16(16#3555, 0.33325195),
 1028:     %% others
 1029:     ?FP16(16#4000, 2),
 1030:     ?FP16(16#4000, 2.0),
 1031:     ok.
 1032: 
 1033: -define(ERROR_INFO(Expr),
 1034:         fun() ->
 1035:                 try Expr of
 1036:                     _ ->
 1037:                         error(should_fail)
 1038:                 catch
 1039:                     error:Reason:Stk ->
 1040:                         error_info_verify(Reason, Stk, ??Expr, #{})
 1041:                 end
 1042:         end()).
 1043: 
 1044: -define(ERROR_INFO(Expr, Overrides),
 1045:         fun() ->
 1046:                 try Expr of
 1047:                     _ ->
 1048:                         error(should_fail)
 1049:                 catch
 1050:                     error:Reason:Stk ->
 1051:                         error_info_verify(Reason, Stk, ??Expr, Overrides)
 1052:                 end
 1053:         end()).
 1054: 
 1055: error_info(_Config) ->
 1056:     Atom = id(some_atom),
 1057:     NegSize = id(-1),
 1058:     HugeNegSize = id(-1 bsl 64),
 1059:     Binary = id(<<"abc">>),
 1060:     HugeBig = id(1 bsl 1500),
 1061:     LongList = lists:seq(1, 100),
 1062: 
 1063:     {badarg, {1,binary,type,Atom}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Atom/binary, Binary/binary>>),
 1064:     {badarg, {2,binary,type,Atom}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Binary/binary, Atom/binary>>),
 1065:     {badarg, {3,binary,type,Atom}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<1:32, Binary/binary, Atom/binary>>),
 1066:     {badarg, {4,binary,type,Atom}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<1:32, "xyz", Binary/binary, Atom/binary>>),
 1067: 
 1068:     {badarg, {1,integer,type,Atom}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Atom:32>>),
 1069:     {badarg, {1,integer,type,Atom}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Atom:(id(32))>>),
 1070:     {badarg, {1,integer,type,LongList}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<LongList:32>>),
 1071:     {badarg, {1,integer,size,Atom}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<42:Atom>>),
 1072:     {badarg, {1,integer,type,Atom}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Atom:32>>),
 1073:     {badarg, {1,integer,size,NegSize}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<42:NegSize>>),
 1074:     {badarg, {1,integer,size,HugeNegSize}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<42:HugeNegSize>>),
 1075:     {system_limit, {1,integer,size,1 bsl 58}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<42:(1 bsl 58)/unit:255>>),
 1076:     {system_limit, {1,integer,size,1 bsl 60}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<42:(1 bsl 60)/unit:8>>),
 1077:     {system_limit, {1,integer,size,1 bsl 64}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<42:(1 bsl 64)>>),
 1078: 
 1079:     {badarg, {1,binary,type,Atom}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Atom:10/binary>>),
 1080:     {badarg, {1,binary,type,Atom}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Atom:(id(10))/binary>>),
 1081:     {badarg, {1,binary,size,Atom}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Binary:Atom/binary>>),
 1082:     {badarg, {1,binary,size,NegSize}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Binary:NegSize/binary>>),
 1083:     {badarg, {1,binary,size,HugeNegSize}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Binary:HugeNegSize/binary>>),
 1084:     {badarg, {1,binary,short,Binary}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Binary:10/binary>>),
 1085:     {badarg, {1,binary,short,Binary}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Binary:(id(10))/binary>>),
 1086:     {badarg, {1,binary,type,Atom}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Atom/binary>>),
 1087:     {badarg, {1,binary,unit,<<1:1>>}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<(id(<<1:1>>))/binary>>),
 1088:     {badarg, {1,binary,unit,<<0:1111>>}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<(id(<<0:1111>>))/binary>>),
 1089:     {badarg, {2,binary,unit,<<1:1>>}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<0, (id(<<1:1>>))/binary>>),
 1090:     {badarg, {2,binary,unit,<<0:1111>>}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<0, (id(<<0:1111>>))/binary>>),
 1091:     {system_limit, {1,binary,size,1 bsl 64}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Binary:(1 bsl 64)/binary>>),
 1092:     {system_limit, {1,binary,size,1 bsl 64}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Binary:(id(1 bsl 64))/binary>>),
 1093: 
 1094:     {badarg, {1,float,type,Atom}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Atom:64/float>>),
 1095:     {badarg, {1,float,size,Atom}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Atom:Atom/float>>),
 1096:     {badarg, {1,float,size,NegSize}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<42.0:NegSize/float>>),
 1097:     {badarg, {1,float,size,HugeNegSize}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<42.0:HugeNegSize/float>>),
 1098:     {badarg, {1,float,invalid,1}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<42.0:(id(1))/float>>),
 1099:     {badarg, {1,float,no_float,HugeBig}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<HugeBig:(id(64))/float>>),
 1100:     {badarg, {1,float,no_float,HugeBig}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<HugeBig:64/float>>),
 1101:     {system_limit, {1,float,size,1 bsl 64}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<42.0:(id(1 bsl 64))/float>>),
 1102: 
 1103:     {badarg, {1,utf8,type,Atom}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Atom/utf8>>),
 1104:     {badarg, {1,utf16,type,Atom}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Atom/utf16>>),
 1105:     {badarg, {1,utf32,type,Atom}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Atom/utf32>>),
 1106: 
 1107:     Bin = id(<<>>),
 1108:     Float = id(42.0),
 1109:     MaxSmall = (1 bsl 59) - 1,                  %Max small for 64-bit architectures.
 1110: 
 1111:     %% Attempt constructing a binary with total size 1^64 + 32.
 1112: 
 1113:     {system_limit, {1,integer,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<0:(MaxSmall)/unit:32,0:64>>),
 1114:     {system_limit, {1,integer,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<0:(MaxSmall)/unit:32,(id(0)):64>>),
 1115:     {system_limit, {1,integer,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<0:(id(MaxSmall))/unit:32,0:64>>),
 1116:     {system_limit, {1,integer,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<0:(id(MaxSmall))/unit:32,(id(0)):64>>),
 1117: 
 1118:     {system_limit, {1,binary,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Bin:(MaxSmall)/binary-unit:32,0:64>>),
 1119:     {system_limit, {1,binary,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Bin:(MaxSmall)/binary-unit:32,(id(0)):64>>),
 1120:     {system_limit, {1,binary,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Bin:(id(MaxSmall))/binary-unit:32,0:64>>),
 1121:     {system_limit, {1,binary,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Bin:(id(MaxSmall))/binary-unit:32,(id(0)):64>>),
 1122: 
 1123:     {system_limit, {1,float,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Float:(MaxSmall)/float-unit:32,0:64>>),
 1124:     {system_limit, {1,float,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Float:(MaxSmall)/float-unit:32,(id(0)):64>>),
 1125:     {system_limit, {1,float,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Float:(id(MaxSmall))/float-unit:32,0:64>>),
 1126:     {system_limit, {1,float,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Float:(id(MaxSmall))/float-unit:32,(id(0)):64>>),
 1127: 
 1128:     %% Test a size exceeding 1^64, where the sign bit (bit 63) is not set.
 1129:     0 = (((MaxSmall) * 33) bsr 63) band 1, %Assertion: The sign bit is not set.
 1130: 
 1131:     {system_limit, {1,integer,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<0:(MaxSmall)/unit:33>>),
 1132:     {system_limit, {1,integer,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<0:(MaxSmall)/unit:33>>),
 1133:     {system_limit, {1,integer,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<0:(id(MaxSmall))/unit:33>>),
 1134:     {system_limit, {1,integer,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<0:(id(MaxSmall))/unit:33>>),
 1135: 
 1136:     {system_limit, {1,binary,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Bin:(MaxSmall)/binary-unit:33>>),
 1137:     {system_limit, {1,binary,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Bin:(MaxSmall)/binary-unit:33>>),
 1138:     {system_limit, {1,binary,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Bin:(id(MaxSmall))/binary-unit:33>>),
 1139:     {system_limit, {1,binary,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Bin:(id(MaxSmall))/binary-unit:33>>),
 1140: 
 1141:     {system_limit, {1,float,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Float:(MaxSmall)/float-unit:33>>),
 1142:     {system_limit, {1,float,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Float:(MaxSmall)/float-unit:33>>),
 1143:     {system_limit, {1,float,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Float:(id(MaxSmall))/float-unit:33>>),
 1144:     {system_limit, {1,float,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Float:(id(MaxSmall))/float-unit:33>>),
 1145: 
 1146:     %% error messages with options
 1147:     PP = fun(Term) -> <<"'", (erlang:atom_to_binary(Term))/binary, "'">> end,
 1148: 
 1149:     {_, _, <<"segment 1 of type 'float': expected a float or an integer but got: some_atom">>} =
 1150:         ?ERROR_INFO(<<Atom:64/float>>, #{}),
 1151: 
 1152:     {_, _, <<"segment 2 of type 'float': expected a float or an integer but got: some_atom">>} =
 1153:         ?ERROR_INFO(<<Atom:64/float>>, #{override_segment_position => 2}),
 1154: 
 1155:     {_, _, <<"segment 1 of type 'float': expected a float or an integer but got: 'some_atom'">>} =
 1156:         ?ERROR_INFO(<<Atom:64/float>>, #{pretty_printer => PP}),
 1157: 
 1158:     ok.
 1159: 
 1160: error_info_verify(Reason, Stk0, Expr, Overrides) ->
 1161:     [{?MODULE, Fun, Arity, Info0}|Rest] = Stk0,
 1162:     {value, {error_info, ErrorInfo}, Info1} = lists:keytake(error_info, 1, Info0),
 1163:     #{cause := Cause, module := Module, function := Function} = ErrorInfo,
 1164:     Info2 = maps:merge(ErrorInfo, Overrides),
 1165:     Stk1 = [{?MODULE, Fun, Arity, Info1 ++ [{error_info, Info2}]} | Rest],
 1166:     Result = Module:Function(Reason, Stk1),
 1167:     #{general := String} = Result,
 1168:     true = is_binary(String),
 1169:     io:format("~ts: ~ts\n", [Expr,String]),
 1170:     {Reason, Cause, String}.
 1171: 
 1172: %%%
 1173: %%% Common utilities.
 1174: %%%
 1175: 
 1176: id(I) -> I.
